intro: Krynitzkia multicaulis var. setosa, commonly known as the hairy stalked krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it an interesting addition to botanical collections.
